Order.title: Order
Order.description: Represents a customer's JasTip (jasa titip) order.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Order entity.

userId.description: Reference to User. (Relationship: User 1:N Order). The ID of the user who placed the order.

customerName.description: The name of the customer who this order is for.

itemDescription.description: Description of the item being ordered.

quantity.description: Quantity of the item being ordered.

specialRequests.description: Any special requests or instructions for the order.

orderDate.description: The date and time the order was placed.

status.description: The current status of the order (e.g., placed, processing, completed).

totalCost.description: The total cost of the order.

notaId.description: Reference to Nota. (Relationship: Nota 1:1 Order). The ID of the generated nota/receipt for the order.

items.description: Itemized list of products in order

totalAmount.description: The total amount due, matching the Order's totalCost.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore structure is designed to provide a secure and scalable solution for the JasTip Express application, prioritizing Authorization Independence, Clarity of Intent, and adherence to DBAC principles.  The structure uses path-based ownership for user-related data and explicitly defines the schemas to ensure data clarity and predictability.

**Authorization Independence:**

*   The structure leverages path-based ownership for entities related to the user. For example, Orders are stored under `/users/{userId}/orders/{orderId}`. This eliminates the need for `get()` calls in security rules to determine ownership, as access control can be directly enforced based on the path.

**QAPs (Rules are not Filters):**

*   The use of structural segregation, with orders stored directly under user documents (`/users/{userId}/orders/{orderId}`), ensures that listing operations can be securely performed based on the `userId` without needing to filter based on document content. Only the user has read access to their specific `/users/{userId}/orders` collection.

*   The Nota subcollection follows the same pattern, ensuring secure access to receipt data based on the parent Order document and user ownership.

* Added an 'events' collection to store Jastip events. Events are public, and can be managed by any authenticated user.
